Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.server.lobby

Class Lobby

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.network.server.lobby.Lobby
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observer
    public class Lobby
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observer
    A collection of Players logged together, waiting for a Game to start. Players should be identified through a unique value and the Lobby should contain only one instance of the same Player.

    • Field Detail

      • MAX_PLAYERS

        private final int MAX_PLAYERS
        The maximum number of Players a Lobby can contain.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • WAITING_TIME_FULL

        private final int WAITING_TIME_FULL
        The initial waiting time before the Lobby launches a new Game. This is modified through adjustTimer().
        See Also:
        Game, adjustTimer(), Constant Field Values

      • WAITING_TIME_REDUCED

        private final int WAITING_TIME_REDUCED
        The cap to the waiting time, in seconds, after the Lobby reached it maximum capacity at least once.
        See Also:
        MAX_PLAYERS, Constant Field Values

      • WAITING_TIME_MARGIN

        private final int WAITING_TIME_MARGIN
        The initial value of timeMargin.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • timeMargin

        private int timeMargin
        The duration, in seconds, of a short interval of time given to a Lobby before starting the game, and the amount by which the timer gets delayed when the amount of players size() drops to the minimum allowed for the lobby, i.e. Game.MINIMUM_PLAYER_COUNT;

      • timer

        private final CountDownTimer timer
        The timer responsible for the countdown before the game starts. Calling CountDownTimer should be performed only in adjustTimer().
        See Also:
        CountDownTimer, adjustTimer()

      • timerStarted

        private boolean timerStarted
        This flag indicates whether or not the CountDownTimer has already started his countdown. This flag is active only when the timer is actually performing its task, meaning that if a "pause", "stop" or "expired" event occurs, it is immediately deactivated.

      • players

        private final java.util.List<Player> players
        The List containing all of the Players currently logged into the Lobby. This is a real time up-to-date Players list until the Game starts. After that the list became immutable: no new Players can be added and old ones cam be removed.

      • previousPlayersAmount

        private int previousPlayersAmount
        This value is updated together with players size() whenever a Player is added or removed from the Lobby. This variable stores the value hold by players size() immediately before the add(Player, String) or remove(Player) operation is performed. Ideally this value represents the number of Players found into the Lobby at the previous step, when the new one was not yet added or the old one was not yet removed.

      • name

        private final java.lang.String name
        The Lobby name. This is chosen when the Lobby is created for the first time and does not change throughout its entire lifetime.

      • password

        private final java.lang.String password
        The Lobby password. This is chosen when the Lobby is created for the first time and does not change throughout its entire lifetime. The password is stored as plain text and does not serve any security purpose.

      • game

        private Game game
        The Game starting with players as participants from this Lobby.
        See Also:
        Game

      • gameProperty

        private GameProperty gameProperty
        The properties needed in order to play a new Game.
        See Also:
        GameProperty

        Parameters:

        the number of Players currently logged into this Lobby.

      • getStatus

        java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getStatus()
        Returns a Map.Entry containing the current status of this Lobby. The status of a Lobby is defined by his name and the number of Players currently logged-in, out of the maximum number of Players. Example: Suppose a Lobby is called "foo" and contains 3 Players out of 5. The return value will be: ("foo", "[3/5]").
        Returns:
        the Map.Entry representing the lobby current status.

      • contains

        boolean contains​(Player player)
        Returns true if, and only if, this Lobby contains the given Player.
        Parameters:
        player - the Player whose presence in this list is to be tested.
        Returns:
        true if this Lobby contains the given Player, false otherwise.

      • add

        void add​(Player player,
         java.lang.String password)
  throws LobbyFullException,
         PlayerAlreadyAddedException,
         InvalidPasswordException,
         GameAlreadyStartedException
        Insert the given player into this Lobby if some criteria are satisfied. Then call adjustTimer() to adjust the timer countdown. This behavior occurs before a new Game is started: after this event the list become immutable: no other Players can be added. The only operation possible is to update a Player's ServerCommunicationInterface with a new one. This happens when a Player disconnects from the Game and reconnects after a certain amount of time.

        The insertion criteria (that applies before the Game starts) are: 1 - there must be a space left in the Lobby. This is true if players.size() is less than MAX_PLAYERS. 2 - the player can't be null. 3 - the Lobby can't contain another instance of Player p, so that player.equals(p). 4- ether only one of the following conditions must be satisfied: a - the given password must be the same a this.password, so that password.equals(this.password). b - both the given password and this.password must be null simultaneously. c - this.password must be either null or such that this.password.isEmpty() and password must be either null or such that password.isBlank().

        Parameters:
        player - the Player to insert into the Lobby.
        password - the authentication password to allow player to be inserted into this Lobby.
        Throws:
        LobbyFullException - if this Lobby has no space left.
        PlayerAlreadyAddedException - if this Lobby already contains another instance of the same player.
        InvalidPasswordException - if password does not satisfy one of the validity conditions.
        GameAlreadyStartedException - if the Game has already started.
        See Also:
        adjustTimer()

      • remove

        void remove​(Player player)
     throws LobbyEmptyException,
            PlayerNotFoundException
        Removes the given Player from the Lobby if all of the following criteria are satisfied: 1 - the Lobby can't be empty. 2 - the player argument can't be null. 3 - the Lobby must contain an instance p of the given player, so that p.equals(player).

        This behavior applies until a new Game is started. Since that, no other Players can be removed due to the fact that a disconnected Player must be recognizable at the moment he decides to join again the Lobby he was connected before.

        Parameters:
        player - the Player to be removed.
        Throws:
        LobbyEmptyException - if the Lobby does not contain any Player.
        PlayerNotFoundException - if the Player passed as parameter is not contained into the Lobby.
        See Also:
        adjustTimer()

      • adjustTimer

        private void adjustTimer()
        This function is called every time a new Player is added to this Lobby or an existing one is removed, only if the game is not started yet. This function adjusts the CountDownTimer countdown based on the number of Players logged into the Lobby, represented by players.size(). Every time the number of Players changes, a delay value can be evaluate to adjust the countdown.
        See Also:
        CountDownTimer

      • notifyExpired

        private void notifyExpired()
        Notifies all the players that the timer has been expired.

      • notifyTimeUpdate

        private void notifyTimeUpdate​(int seconds)
        Notifies all the players that the timer has performed a time update.
        Parameters:
        seconds - the new amount of time left to count down from.

      • notifyTimeUpdate

        void notifyTimeUpdate()
        Notifies all the players that the timer has been updated with a value new value and therefore the Players should be notified.

      • notifyStopped

        private void notifyStopped()
        Notifies all the players that the timer has been stopped or paused due to not enough Players left in the Lobby.

      • notifyOpponentUpdate

        void notifyOpponentUpdate()
        Notifies all the players with the updated list of all the other Players logged in the same Lobby, except himself.

      • onEvent

        public void onEvent​(int eventStatus,
                    int value)
        This function is called when the timer experience a relevant update while performing the countdown. Depending on the eventStatus that has been triggered and its content, different actions may be taken to respond accordingly to the occurred event.
        Specified by:
        onEvent in interface Observer
        Parameters:
        eventStatus - the status in which the Observable is found when performs the call to notifyEvent().
        value - the value of the actual event status.
        See Also:
        Observer
